definition: to stew in soy sauce and spices
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: Drink rib soup, braised pork rice and goose the volume is the best match.
sentences.chinese: 喝排骨汤，卤肉饭和鹅卷是最佳匹配。

sentences.english: I was more turned on by this gravy boat than by Barry.
sentences.chinese: 我发现我对这个船形卤肉盘比对巴里更有冲动。

sentences.english: This really gorgeous Lamauge gravy boat.
sentences.chinese: 非常漂亮的船形卤肉盘。

definition: to stew in soy sauce and spices
variant of 滷味|卤味[lu3 wei4]
food prepared by stewing in soy sauce and spices
five spice seasoned/incorporating the five basic flavors of Chinese cooking (sweet, sour, bitter, savory, salty)
(dialect) minced or diced meat (as part of a dish)
vermicelli made from mung bean starch etc
raw materials for making soup/packaged soup mix
